Package it.unipr.barbato.Model.Message

Class ElectionHandler

java.lang.Object
it.unipr.barbato.Model.Message.ElectionHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Handler, jakarta.jms.MessageListener
public class ElectionHandler extends Object implements Handler, jakarta.jms.MessageListener
The ElectionHandler class implements the Handler and MessageListener interfaces and represents a handler for the election process in the distributed system. It sends and receives election messages, waits for responses, and coordinates the nodes in the system. The master node is elected based on Ring Algorithm.
Author:
Vincenzo Barbato 345728

      public void election()
      Set up and check if is possible to start the election process. If is possible start the election process.

    • sendPidsList

      private void sendPidsList(ArrayList<Integer> list, int index)
      Send the list of process IDs to the next node in the list. If the next node doesn't respond, the list is propagated to the next of the next node. If the next node is the current node, the election process is stopped.
      Parameters:
      list - the list of process IDs
      index - the index of the next node in the list

    • setMaster

      public void setMaster(Boolean m, Integer pidMaster)
      Set the master node and the process ID of the master node.
      Parameters:
      m - the master node flag
      pidMaster - the process ID of the master node

      Parameters:
      pids - the list of process IDs
      targetPid - the target process ID
      Returns:
      the index of the next process ID in the list
